description:
**Software Documentation** is one of the most crucial component of an
open source software, as it determines either the adoption or the
failure of the project. For this reason, a big effort is currently
devoted in the community to `support <https://www.python.org/doc/>`__
and
`sustain <https://devguide.python.org/documentation/help-documenting/index.html>`__
an entire ecosystem of documentation
`tools <https://wiki.python.org/moin/DocumentationTools>`__ and
frameworks (e.g. ```diataxis`` <https://diataxis.fr/>`__).

Good examples of great software docs certainly include
`Django <https://www.djangoproject.com/>`__ framework, or
`Scikit-learn <https://scikit-learn.org/>`__, whose
`examples <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/auto_examples/index.html>`__
are made available for interactive execution in Jupyter-like
environments.

Nevertheless, recent advances to `Python on
WASM <https://peps.python.org/pep-0011/#tier-3>`__ enables unprecedented
scenarios for interactivity, giving users the ability to run code
directly in the browser, with no setup required, and without leaving the
documentation at all!

This is the angle I would like to explore with this talk, with
particular emphasis on the `PyScript <https://pyscript.net>`__ platform.
In fact PyScript integrates multiple
`interpreters <https://pyscript.github.io/docs/2023.12.1/user-guide/architecture/#interpreters>`__;
it features a new Pythonic
`API <(https://pyscript.github.io/docs/2023.12.1/user-guide/dom/)>`__
for the DOM; supports non-blocking execution threads using
`WebWorkers <https://pyscript.github.io/docs/2023.12.1/user-guide/workers/>`__;
and ships core-plugins providing `Python
Terminals <https://pyscript.github.io/docs/2023.12.1/user-guide/terminal/>`__,
and notebook-like `code
editors <https://pyscript.github.io/docs/2023.12.1/user-guide/terminal/>`__
running directly in the browser. All those features fit perfectly in the
context of interactive documentation, and will be demonstrated in action
in this talk as proof-of-principle.
title: Interactive Software Documentation, with PyScript
